alert.note: Alert for Bell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 20 at 12:04AM EDT until August 20 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Bell County in southeastern Kentucky... * Until 100 AM EDT. * At 1204 AM EDT, multiple reports on social media show flash flooding along KY-221 in the Mill Creek area. Up to 4 inches of rain have fallen. The showers and storms which produced the rainfall have moved out. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Public reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Kettle Island, Callaway, Stony Fork Junction, Arjay, Blackmont, Cary and Straight Creek. This includes the following streams and drainages... Sims Fork, Left Fork Straight Creek, Stoney Fork, Ben Howard Branch, Mill Creek, Straight Creek, Newtown Branch, James York Branch, Wieser Branch, Cumberland River and Left Fork Caney Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
